head.title: Even a Dorm Can Feel Like Home

hedline.hl1: Even a Dorm Can Feel Like Home

abstract.p: Personal Shopper column on sources and prices of furnishings and other items suitable for college dormitory rooms; photos (M)

block.p: SINCE college dorm rooms are plain vanilla boxes, only the details distinguish one student's room from another. Accessories like a slouchy lounge chair and a hefty CD rack can personalize the space and make it feel like home.
1. A translucent plastic cordless phone comes in four fruit colors: lime, watermelon, blueberry or grape; $39.99 at Target, (888) 304-4000 or www.target.com.

SINCE college dorm rooms are plain vanilla boxes, only the details distinguish one student's room from another. Accessories like a slouchy lounge chair and a hefty CD rack can personalize the space and make it feel like home.
1. A translucent plastic cordless phone comes in four fruit colors: lime, watermelon, blueberry or grape; $39.99 at Target, (888) 304-4000 or www.target.com.
2. A transparent perpetual wall calendar with pockets for each day is $25 at Property, 14 Wooster Street.

The Q chaise, a fabric-covered foam rubber lounge, folds into a 27-inch cube or converts into an upright chair with an ottoman. Designed by Karim Rashid for Umbra, the chair comes in black or charcoal gray; $250 at Mxyplyzyk, 125 Greenwich Avenue (13th Street), or (800) 387-5122 for stores outside New York.
A steel floor lamp for reading is $39.99 at Target.
Egholt, a 4-by-6-foot acrylic pile rug, has footprints that glow in the dark; $24.95 at Ikea, www.ikea.com or (800) 434-4532.
3. A wall-mounted plastic ''stone,'' three feet long, holds 65 CD's and can be painted; $125 at S. Feldman Housewares, 1304 Madison Avenue (93rd Street).
4. Light-up accents based on sign designs -- a box that says ''Telephone'' ($24.99) or male or female figures ($19.99 each) -- are from Target.
From Ikea: Antifoni, a sleek matte-silver work lamp, is $39.95; the Oppala nylon and steel lounge chair is $19.95; and the Solbjerg synthetic pile rug, 4 by 6 feet, is $19.95.
The Nuvo phone glows red when in use; $28.98 at Mxyplyzyk.

5. A chair with two connected cushions (one leans against the wall) offers a new take on the old beanbag. It is covered in bright orange nylon and costs $190. For $210, it can be ordered with a third cushion that folds out to create a bed; at Totem, 71 Franklin Street, or www.totem.com.

A plastic rug, impervious to spills and stains, comes in three sizes, 60 by 80 inches ($65), 72 by 80 inches ($75) or 90 by 80 inches ($85). The rug is available in plaids or stripes in a variety of bright colors; at Galileo, 37 Seventh Avenue (13th Street).
A cozy blanket made of gray sweatshirt material edged in bright orange is $39.99 at Bed, Bath & Beyond, www.bedbathandbeyond.com or (800) 462-3966.

6. The Curly bulletin board has flexible spiral tabs -- no pushpins needed -- to hold family photos and important pieces of paper like course registration forms. It is $14.99 in gray or clear plastic from the Container Store, (800) 733-3532.
7. Trynen is a 63-inch-high vanity made of washable nylon. It hangs on the wall, in blue or red, with a removable mirror, small shelf and zippered pockets; $19.99 at Ikea.
